titleStmt.title: O Say Can You See Personography

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/). Derivatives must be credited to O Say Can You See, made available non-commercially, and distributed under the same terms. Requests for permission for commercial publication or other use should be emailed to the project team.

sourceDesc.p:
This file was compiled from information found in
National Archives and Records Administration Records of the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia.; Law, Appellate, and Criminal Records; Case Papers 1802-1863 RG21
VIAF: The Virtual International Authority File OCLC Online Computer Library Center, Inc. http://viaf.org

person.persName: Person does not yet have an ID
Scott, Sabret Sabrett Sabrit Saberit Sabritt

person.note: Mother of child not named in petition.
Henny Joyce is the name of both the mother and daughter of Sarah Joyce.
Henny Joyce is the name of both the mother and daughter of Sarah Joyce.
Mother of infant unnamed in petition.

person.persName: Queen, Mary Papaw Pappow Queen Mary

person.residence: neighbourhood of James Carroll's Plantation called Fingall (Fingaul Plantation [Md.])

person.note: Phillis is the name of both the mother and daughter of Susan Bordley
Wife of James Miller. Daughter of Mrs. Pottinger.
Not the same Richard Johnson, petitioner vs. Janet Lingan.

person.occupation: Register of Wills for St. Mary's County

person.note: Not the James Thompson who is a petitioner against Electius Spalding.
John Thompson is the name of the brother and the nephew of Thomas Thompson.
May be the same person as Ignatius Mattingly (per.000390).
May be the same person as Ignatius Mallingly, Jr. (per.000387).
May be same person as Margaret Norris, per.000403.
May be same person as Marge Norris, per.000402.
Not the James Thompson from Joe Thompson v. Walter Clarke.

trait.note: "a Black man of rather bright complexion about 32 years of age ... straight rather delicately made no marks about his face full prominent mouth deep sunk under the eyes flat head has a scar on his leg left near the inside above the ankle"

person.note: Forename unknown. May be Richard R. Burr.

person.occupation: member of Congress from North Carolina
deputy clerk of the county court

person.note: May be the same William Digges in case.0018 (per.000174).
May be the same Joseph Beck (per.000081) who was a juror in the Mima Queen v. John Hepburn case.

person.persName: Lee, Janette Jane Janett Jeanett Jeane

person.note: May be the same Burr (per.000479) as in case oscys.case.0048.001 Randall v. Reid.
May be the same Anthony Addison (per.000167) mentioned in oscys.case.0017.004
May be the same James Miller (per.000144) as in Susan Bordley v. Anne Tilley oscys.case.0016.003.
This may be the Robert Clarke (per.00086) who was on the jury list for Queen v. Hepburn (http://earlywashingtondc.org/doc/oscys.case.0011.013).

trait.note: "a black man abt 44 yrs of age abt 5 feet 10 Inches high, ... stout & well made, having 2 small scars on his forehead over his right eye a small scar on the right side of his upper lip. a small scar over his left eye. and rather a pleasing countenance."

person.note: Possibly related to John Baptist Lee (per.000630) petitioner in John Baptist Lee v. Augustus Preuss (http://earlywashingtondc.org/doc/oscys.case.0075.001)
May be Thomas Corcoran (per.000010) as in Ann Shorter v. Thomas Corcoran.
May be the Alexander Moore (per.000712) who is the defendant in this case.

person.occupation: chief justice of the Supreme Court

person.note: May be the same John Coburn (per.000592) as in http://earlywashingtondc.org/doc/oscys.case.0070.002.
Unlikely the same person as Daniel Bell (per.000871).
May be the same person as per.000116.
May be the same person as per.000641.
Last name unknown. Likely the same person as per.000816.
Likely the same person as per.000815.
Doctor may be occupation, not name.

trait.note: "a black woman of light complexion, about 44 yrs of age & about 5.1. high, stout & well made, having a scar on her left eye brow, one near the left corner of her mouth occasioned by a fall, one on her upper lip, one between the second & third joints of the fore finger of her left hand and one on her right arm between the wrist & elbow joints occasioned by a burn."

person.note: Unlikely to be the same Daniel Bell as per.000773.

person.persName: Trunnell Trunel Trunnells Trammells Trammel, Ellen

person.note: May be the attorney for the petitioners. If so change in case and rdf.
Likely not the same Thomas Keene as per.000043.
Not the same Elizabeth Smith as
There is also an Ennis in case 109.001 but that person has a last name only.
This may be the same person as per.000863.
May be J. B. H. Smith or B. P. Smith
May be the same William Morton as per.000799.

Confined as runaway slave William Thomas (per.001056).
May be Joseph W. Neale (per.000863) from oscys.case.0114.001.

trait.note: "a black man of rather light complexion about forty eight years of age & about five feet high, stout build and having several large scars ... on his breast, a small scar on his forehead near the right corner of his left eyebrow; and large features."

person.note: This may be the same James Smith as per.000459.
May be the same person as Thomas D. Owens (per.001062).
This may be the same as per.000970.

Possibly related to other John Lees (per.000630 and per.000700).
Possibly the same person as per.001170.
This is not the same person as per.000502. The Henry Ashton (per.000502) is a marshal. This Henry Ashton is an attorney.
First name of Henry comes from external attorney list.

trait.note: "a black woman of light complexion, about 29 yrs of age & about 5.6 high, having a small scar under her left cheek bone, one on the back of her left hand, near the wrist joint, one between the wrist & 2d joint of the thumb of her left hand, one near the right wrist joint, & one large one just above her right breast."
